qas.question: In what year did the company that was to become IBM form?
What was the name of the company that eventually became IBM?
In what year did IBM get its name?
What nickname was given to IBM?
What is one parent company of the Computing-Tabulating-Recording Company?
What was the original name of the Bundy Manufacturing Company?
In what year was the Bundy Manufacturing Company created?
What was the nickname that was used for the Bundy Manufacturing Company?
Who first used the name Bundy Manufacturing Company?
Why did  Thomas J. Watson first use the name Bundy Maufacturing Company?

context: The company originated in <a0_0><b6_0>1911<b6_0/><a0_0/> as <b5_0>the <a1_0>Computing-Tabulating-Recording Company<b5_0/> (CTR)<a1_0/> through the consolidation of The Tabulating Machine Company, the International Time Recording Company, the <a4_0>Computing Scale Company<a4_0/> and the Bundy Manufacturing Company. CTR was renamed "International Business Machines" in <a2_0>1924<a2_0/>, a name which <b8_0>Thomas J. Watson<b8_0/> first used <b9_0>for a CTR Canadian subsidiary<b9_0/>. The initialism IBM followed. Securities analysts nicknamed the company <a3_0><b7_0>Big Blue<b7_0/><a3_0/> for its size and common use of the color in products, packaging and its logo.
